text: With eery vigour Lokjar wades across the front lines of any daring enemy warband.
Few swing and hack tirelessly as Lokjar Bjoergir, scourge of the frozen tundra.
Stolen from a Norse dwarfish blacksmith, Lokjar's retinue dresses in sturdy and stalwart armour.
The band formelry led by Tjodalf was known for hunting unnatural chaotic beasts in tedious and long monster hunts.
The group of marauders led by Chieftain Tjodalf Smödir once was revered and famed throughout the frozen wastes.
As time progresses the strange monolith Lokjar's men crossed appears in their increasingly disturbing dreams.
Not many marauders may claim to have slain a White Dragon, yet the retinue of Tjodalf achieved the impossible.
The uncanning cry bellowed by Tjodalf as Lokjar betrayed him is both a warning and an inspiration for marauders following Bjoergir's footsteps.
As she blows the Graeling horn hunters gather for their feast: The Hunt.
A mighty champion of the frozen mountains who once betrayed his chieftain to achieve eternal glory.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

The magical weapon was crafted out of the skull of a White Dragon, who was known for preferring killing his victims with one mighty bite of his enormous jaws.
